channel.title: DHCP on Stuff I've Figured Out
channel.description: Recent content in DHCP on Stuff I've Figured Out

item.title: IPv6 Network (Auto) Configuration
item.description: In my previous article, IPv6 Tunneling over IPv4 Networks, I discussed how to connect a LAN to the IPv6 public Internet. This article continues the theme, discussing the issues surrounding the LAN’s configuration for IPv6. Looking at how LAN’s are configured for IPv4 proves to be instructive. Many of the techniques, and all of the patterns turn out to have parallels in IPv6. During the design of IPv6 engineers took the opportunity for refactoring using lessons learned from IPv4.
